articles.title: 2nd Session of 13th Supreme People's Assembly of DPRK Held
articles.content:
2nd Session of 13th Supreme People's Assembly of DPRK Held
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The 2nd Session of the 13th Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK was held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Thursday.
					 Present there were deputies to the SPA.
					
					 Officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, public organizations, ministries, national institutions and the fields of science, 
					
					education, literature and art, public health and media attended it as observers.
					
					 All the participants observed a moment's silence in memory of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 SPA Chairman Choe Thae Bok made an opening address.
					
					 The session discussed agenda items on summing up the implementation of "On Enforcing Universal 12-Year Compulsory Education", the Ordinance of the SPA of the DPRK, and an organizational matter.
					
					Deputy Pak Pong Ju, premier of the Cabinet, made a report on the first agenda item.
					
					The reporter said that the 6th Session of the 12th SPA held in September, Juche 101 (2012) promulgated Ordinance on Enforcing Universal 12-Year Compulsory Education in line with the new requirements of the developing revolution.
					
					 According to the report, a work for successfully enforcing the schooling has been dynamically pushed forward as the one involving the whole state, all people and the whole society and signal successes have been made in it.
					
					 The work for operating the six-year secondary schools by dividing them into three-year junior secondary schools and three-year senior secondary schools has been wound up in a brief span of time. The first phase programs for the universal 12-year compulsory education were worked out in a matter of one and half years and textbooks of new contents and style were compiled.
					
					 Expenditure has been increased in educational field at the state budget, the State Planning Commission, the Ministry of Finance, provincial people's committees and relevant institutions have ensured funds needed for educational work as planned, thus strengthening the material and technological foundation of schools.
					
					 Over the past two years since the promulgation of the ordinance new classrooms have been built or constructed on an expansion basis at schools across the country and many school things produced.
					
					 The reporter referred to the tasks facing the field of education.
					
					 He underlined the need to build well the ranks of teachers and decisively raise their qualifications and roles.
					
					 The general senior secondary schools should teach students with main emphasis on general secondary knowledge and senior secondary technical schools should make preparations in a responsible manner for giving education in basic technology to suit the economic and geographical peculiarities of the relevant areas while giving general education in conformity with the operation of senior secondary technical schools, new 
					
					type schooling, on a trial basis, he noted.
					
					 He also underlined the need to positively push ahead with the work for putting the nation's universal general secondary education including genius education on a new high stage, reinforce the research forces at educational and scientific research institutions and increase their responsibilities and roles.
					
					 He called for improving the conditions and environment for education to be fit for the appearance of a highly civilized socialist country.
					
					 Speakers at the session renewed their resolution to decisively improve the quality of education to meet the realistic requirements of the developing education in the age of knowledge-based economy and suit the trend of the world and thus train the younger generation as more dependable revolutionary talents of Juche type equipped with perfect general secondary knowledge, modern basic technological knowledge and creative ability.
					
					 The session adopted "On Comprehensively Enforcing Universal 12-Year Compulsory Education and Decisively Improving Its Quality", the Decision of the SPA of the DPRK.
					
					 It discussed the second agenda item.
					
					 It recalled Deputy Choe Ryong Hae from the post of vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK due to his transfer to other post and Deputy Jang Jong Nam from the post of member of the NDC of the DPRK due to his transfer to other post.
					
					 It elected Deputy Hwang Pyong So to fill the vacancy as vice-chairman of the NDC of the DPRK and Deputies Hyon Yong Chol and Ri Pyong Chol to fill the vacancy as members of the NDC of the DPRK at the proposal of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Spanish King
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Spanish King
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Felipe VI, king of the Kingdom of Spain, on September 8.
					 The king in the message extended congratulations to the people of the DPRK on behalf of the government and people of Spain and on his own behalf on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 It sincerely wished once again the people of the DPRK peace and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Kazakhstan
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Kazakhstan
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Nursultan Nazarbayev, president of the Republic of Kazakhstan, on Sept. 9.
					 The president in the message extended heartfelt congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the Korean people well-being and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Iranian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Iranian President
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Hassan Rouhani, president of the Islamic Republic of Iran, on Sept. 9.
					 The president in the message extended sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the government and people of the DPRK on the occasion of its founding anniversary.
					
					 He expressed the hope that the relations between the Islamic Republic of Iran and the DPRK would expand in the interests of the peoples of the two countries in the fields of mutual interests thanks to the common efforts and cooperation of high-ranking officials of the two countries. 
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and successes in his work and the DPRK government and people happiness and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Namibian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Namibian President
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Hifikepunye Pohamba, president of the Republic of Namibia, on Sept. 5.
					 The president in the message extended the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the government and the people of the DPRK on behalf of the Namibian government and people and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 The message expressed the hope that the good cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow in the mutual interests of the peoples of the two countries. 
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health at all times and success in his work to lead the Korean people to the economic development and social progress.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Gambia
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Gambia
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Yaya A. J. J. Jammeh, president of the Republic of Gambia, on August 28.
					 The message extended the warmest congratulations and best wishes to Kim Jong Un and the brave people of the great DPRK on the occasion of the 66th birth anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 It noted that the government and people of Gambia were pleased to join the people of the DPRK in celebrating this significant anniversary.
					
					 It expressed belief that the good friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Sao Tome and Principe
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Sao Tome and Principe
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Manuel Pinto Da Costa, president of the Democratic Republic of  Sao Tome and Principe, on September 2.
					 The president in the message extended warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the people of Sao Tome and Principe and on his own behalf on the occasion of September 9, the national day of the DPRK.
					
					 The message sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and excellent successes in his work and his family happiness as well as the Korean people progress and wellbeing.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Mozambique
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of Mozambique
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Armando Emilio Guebuza, president of the Republic of Mozambique, on Sept. 4.
					 The president in the message extended the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the government and people of the DPRK on the occasion of the 66th birthday of the great DPRK.
					
					 The president reiterated the will to strengthen the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, celebrating this grand holiday.
					
					 The president sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and the DPRK progress and prosperity on the occasion of this auspicious holiday.

articles.title: South Korean Authorities Accused of Shielding Anti-DPRK Leaflets Scattering Operation
articles.content:
South Korean Authorities Accused of Shielding Anti-DPRK Leaflets Scattering Operation
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces' operations for scattering anti-DPRK leaflets from the area along the Military Demarcation Line are the unjustifiable and most vicious politically-motivated provocations against the DPRK.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces are letting loose such sophism as describing such operations as the ones "reflecting the nature of the social system" and "free activities of the non-governmental organization." They went the lengths of claiming that they remained unchanged in their stand that "there is no legal ground" to check them.
					
					 What they are doing is nothing but reckless acts of zealously instigating human scum and encouraging them to become more frantic in leaflets scattering operations, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Those despicable human scum know nothing but doing bad things.  Explicitly speaking, it is the south Korean authorities that provided them with the job of scattering anti-DPRK leaflets.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces are still not aware that the leaflets which those human scum let fly into areas of the north are like papers for death sentence to them.
					
					 The DPRK has already decided to blow up bases for the anti-DPRK psychological warfare and supporting and commanding forces.
					
					 The Korean People's Army will deal retaliatory blows at any target any time without any prior notice to put an end to their vicious racket.
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to behave themselves, though belatedly, cogitating about the catastrophic consequences to be entailed by their reckless anti-DPRK confrontation racket.

articles.title: U.S. Hegemonic Position Is Sinking in Different Parts of World: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Hegemonic Position Is Sinking in Different Parts of World: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The U.S. chief executive blustered on Sept. 3 that it is the goal of the U.S. to annihilate the Islamic State to prevent it from posing a threat not only to Iraq but to the Mideast and the U.S.
					 Referring to the confrontation with Russia escalating owing to the situation in Ukraine, he asserted that the U.S. regards the security of Baltic countries and East European countries as important as that of Berlin and Paris and cried out for applying the principle of NATO collective security to them.
					
					 The U.S. secretary of State said that the issues related to Iraq, Syria, Ukraine, Gaza Strip, South Sudan, Libya, Korea, etc. are the regional ones to be settled by the U.S. and the U.S. international leadership and involvement should be remembered as its genes.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 His assertion that its positive involvement and leadership would bring about peace to the world is little short of rhetoric of a fool.
					
					 The hegemonic position of the U.S. styling itself "the world's only superpower" is crumbling like a wet wall in different parts of the world.
					
					  Great irony is that the U.S. is not strong enough to put the situation under control. 
					
					 The weakness of the military muscle, one of the strategic mainstays for the U.S., has already been brought to light and its dollar mainstay remains worthless.
					
					  Anti-U.S. sentiment is mounting and the U.S. is hit hard and isolated and rebuffed in different parts of the world. This is the present situation.
					
					 The Pew research center of the U.S. issued the results of opinion poll that 80 percent of the respondents expressed their objection to the U.S. excessive interference in international issues.
					
					  This goes to clearly prove that the world public is opposed to the U.S. reactionary and aggressive policy. The U.S. going against public mind-set is bound to go to ruin as it is an inevitability of history.

articles.title: Minju Joson Marks World Maritime Day
articles.content:
Minju Joson Marks World Maritime Day
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Today is World Maritime Day.
					 Every year on this day the DPRK and other members of the International Maritime Organization conduct diverse activities on relevant themes, says Minju Joson Thursday in an article.
					
					 The theme for this year's World Maritime Day is "Effective Implementation of Convention of the International Maritime Organization."
					
					 It is important to modify and supplement various conventions as required by the developing reality and steadily carry out the work for their thorough implementation, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 As a member of the IMO the DPRK acceded to various conventions such as "international convention on security of people at sea", "international convention on convenient navigation at sea" and "convention on civil responsibility for damage by ship oil contamination" and has sincerely implemented them for more than three decades. It is striving hard for the safe voyage of all ships operating in the territorial waters of the DPRK and for the prevention of sea contamination.
					
					 Last November the DPRK acceded to the "international convention on mobile satellite organization" as part of its efforts to make an active contribution to the international cooperation in the field of maritime communications.

articles.title: Foreigners Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Social Democracy Mongolian Women's Association led by President Tsogzolmaa Tsedenbal and other foreigners visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun Thursday.
					 They paid high tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state the foreigners paid homage to them.
					
					 They looked round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are preserved and the halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 They made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: DPRK Player Grabs Gold at Women's Vault Event of 17th Asian Games
articles.content:
DPRK Player Grabs Gold at Women's Vault Event of 17th Asian Games
 Inchon, September 24 (KCNA Correspondent) -- DPRK player Hong Un Jong placed first at the women's vault event of gymnastics in the 17th Asian Games on Wednesday.
					 She perfectly carried out all movements including 900 degree somersault. A gold medal was awarded to her who came first with 15.349 points.
					
					 DPRK weightlifter Ryo Un Hui lifted 121 kg, 3 kg more than the record set by a Chinese weightlifter before her, in snatch in the 69 kg category of women's weightlifting, thus setting a new record in the Asian Games. She was awarded a silver medal by placing second with 262 kg in total.
					
					 DPRK player Kang Yong Mi came third in uneven bars of gymnastics.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK weightlifter Kim Kwang Song lifted 363 kg in total in the 77 kg category of men's weightlifting, finishing a runner-up.
					
					 DPRK player Jo Pok Hyang placed third at the 63 kg category in women's weightlifting.
					
					 DPRK players came third in the women's team judo matches and skeet shooting events respectively.

articles.title: Sport Tourism Festival Held in Rason of DPRK
articles.content:
Sport Tourism Festival Held in Rason of DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- A sport tourism festival was held in Rason City, the DPRK on Wednesday.
					 Taking part in the festival were more than 250 sports fans from Russia, Mongolia, China, Greece, Denmark, Germany, Sweden and other countries.
					
					 They competed in the event involving 31.5 km of cycling, 21 km of marathon and 3.5 km of running and walking.
					
					 Their competition was viewed by travel agents and sports fans of Rason City and foreign countries and inhabitants in the city.
					
					 Congratulatory speeches were made there, which was followed by a prize-awarding ceremony.

articles.title: Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Closes
articles.content:
Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Closes 
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The 14th Pyongyang International Film Festival closed with due ceremony at the Ponghwa Art Theatre on Wednesday.
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture who is chairman of the organizing committee of the festival, Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, Kim In Bom, vice-minister of Culture and concurrently director of the Film General Bureau, and officials concerned.
					
					 Also present were foreign delegations and delegates and members of the international jury of the festival.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here and their spouses and officials in charge of cultural relations of foreign embassies here. 
					
					 Introduced at the ceremony were films that proved successful at the festival. 
					
					 The jury announced the results and prizes were awarded. 
					
					 A letter of the participants in the film festival to supreme leader Kim Jong Un was adopted at the ceremony. 
					
					 Pak Chun Nam made a closing address.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations, Delegates and Overseas Compatriots Leave
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations, Delegates and Overseas Compatriots Leave
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates of foreign countries and overseas compatriots and members of the international jury left here after participating in the 14th Pyongyang International Film Festival.

articles.title: Reception Given by German Ambassador to DPRK
articles.content:
Reception Given by German Ambassador to DPRK 
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Thomas Schaefer, German ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception at his embassy Thursday on the occasion of the national day of Germany.
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, Paek Yong Ho, executive vice-chairman of the C.C., the DPRK Red Cross Society, officials concerned, foreign diplomats and staff members of the missions of international organizations here.
					
					 Staff members of the German embassy were on hand.

articles.title: National Circus Gives Open-air Performance
articles.content:
National Circus Gives Open-air Performance
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The National Circus gave a performance at the Rungna People's Pleasure Park Thursday.
					 The artistes of the circus put acrobatic numbers on the outdoor stage in the evening.
					
					 Physical acrobatics struck a chord with the audience.
					
					 The wonderful skills displayed by comedy acrobats drew laughs and applauses of the audience. 
					
					 Animal acrobat "goat and monkey" also pleased the audience.
					
					 The circus will continue with its performance and the Samjiyon Band of the Mansudae Art Troupe will also give a performance at the park.

articles.title: International Maritime Day Marked
articles.content:
International Maritime Day Marked
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- An event took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Thursday to mark 2014 International Maritime Day.
					 Present there were officials of the Maritime Administration of the DPRK, officials of relevant units, foreign diplomatic envoys and staff members of their embassies here.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					  The International Maritime Organization adopted relevant laws and regulations beneficial to the maritime development and calls upon all its member nations to sincerely carry them out, the speakers said, adding it set this year's theme as "Effective Implementation of Convention of the International Maritime Organization."
					
					 They referred to the successes made by the DPRK in legalizing and carrying out important conventions and rules adopted by the IMO and the maritime search and rescue structure system and the prospect for protection of the maritime environment.
					
					 The participants watched a video related to the implementation of laws and regulations of the IMO.

articles.title: Participants of Int'l Scientific Symposium Visit Kim Il Sung University
articles.content:
Participants of Int'l Scientific Symposium Visit Kim Il Sung University
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The participants of the International Scientific Symposium of Kim Il Sung University visited the university on Wednesday.
					 They looked round various rooms of the revolutionary museum, being briefed on the exploits of the peerless great persons who paid deep attention to the development of the university.
					
					 They also toured the modern swimming pool of the university, etc.
					
					 Prof. Yannick Bruneton of University of Paris 7 in a visitor's book wrote that the university has been built for students of the DPRK, hoping that cooperation and exchange would be brisk between the two universities.
					
					 Vera Anikina, a Russian expert on Korean language said she would give wide publicity to Kim Il Sung University.

articles.title: New Materials Proving U.S., Japanese Imperialists' Atrocities Displayed
articles.content:
New Materials Proving U.S., Japanese Imperialists' Atrocities Displayed
 Kaesong, September 25 (KCNA) -- The Kaesong City House of Class Education newly discovered and displayed more than 90 books helpful to anti-U.S. and anti-Japanese education and evidence proving the atrocities perpetrated by the U.S. and Japanese imperialists by invading Korea and plundering it of its treasure.
					 Publications of Japan and other countries on display deal with the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists by killing Queen Min and sending the valuables they took from her body to the Japan proper to sell them by auction, vandalizing cultural artifacts of Korea and stealing tens of thousand of relics including Koryo ceramics and other valuables to sell them to various countries.
					
					 Among them are data proving the fact that the Japanese imperialist aggressors took away many Korean women to force them into sexual slavery before killing them and carried to the island country the Kyongchon Tower in Kwangsu-ri, one of Korea's cultural heritages.
					
					 There are medicine bottles and tools used by U.S. missionaries in Kaesong when killing innocent Koreans under the pretext of "treatment" and photos proving them. This indicts the U.S. imperialists to the whole world for their brutal atrocities.
					
					 There are also arms used by the U.S. imperialist aggressors during the Korean war and unexploded bombs discovered in the construction site of Pakyon-Ryongthong Temple tourist road and lethal weapons used by them when killing patriots in Ryohyon-ri and photos proving them.
					
					 Newly discovered and displayed is the pattern of a monument erected by the Korean people in 1871 to reflect their spirit to fight against the aggression by the U.S. and European powers.

articles.title: Functional LED Lamps Developed
articles.content:
Functional LED Lamps Developed
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The Kwangmyong LED Lamp and Solar Battery Factory in the DPRK has recently developed diverse functional LED lamps effective for the production of livestock and vegetable.
					They include lamps that help promote egg-laying and plant growth.
					
					 The egg-laying promotion lamp emits yellowish red light, with consumption of 18W electricity and wavelength of 590-600?. Its introduction made it possible for the Mangyongdae Chicken Farm to raise the egg output 3-4 percent.
					
					 The LED lamp for promoting the plant growth uses 9W of electricity, emitting blue light with 420-460? in wavelength.
					
					 There is also a kind of LED lamp for fishing.

articles.title: New Type of Regional Gingiva Atomizer Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Type of Regional Gingiva Atomizer Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Public Health General Dental Hospital in the DPRK developed a new type of regional gingiva atomizer for treating paradentitis.
					 This apparatus consists of attachment, water tube and sprayer and does not need power consumption.
					
					  It helps remove oral germs through repeated mechanical impetus, having an effect of massage for the whole mouth.
					
					 The atomizer is also available for personal mouth hygiene as it is small in mass.

articles.title: Suppression of Farmers Protesting against Opening of Rice Market Denounced
articles.content:
Suppression of Farmers Protesting against Opening of Rice Market Denounced
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Farmers under the Federation of Peasants Associations of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on September 22 at which they denounced the puppet authorities for suppressing farmers in their struggle against the opening of rice market, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 The food sovereignty on this land has been exposed to a grave threat due to the authorities' traitorous moves to open the rice market, they noted.
					
					 It is unreasonable that the secretariat of the "National Assembly" filed complaint with the police against the farmers who staged a sit-in at the hall of the "National Assemblymen" on September 18 in protest against the unpopular moves to open the rice market, they added.

articles.title: Earthquake Occurs in S. Korea
articles.content:
Earthquake Occurs in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 3.5 on the Richter Scale jolted Kyongju City, North Kyongsang Province on September 23, according to MBC of south Korea.
					 Tremor was reportedly felt in buildings in Ulsan, and Phohang of North Kyongsang Province.

articles.title: Struggle for Independence, Peace and Reunification Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle for Independence, Peace and Reunification Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held a meeting in Seoul on September 22 at which they clarified that they would stage a more dynamic movement for independence, peace and reunification.
					 Mun Kyu Hyon, permanent representative of the organization, Kang Jong Gu, director of the Institute for Peaceful Unification, and others spoke at the meeting.
					
					 The organization has waged an invariable struggle for peace and reunification despite all sorts of suppression and trials for the past 20 years since its formation, the speakers said, and went on:
					
					 In this period actions were staged to build public opinion on such issues as the withdrawal of the U.S. forces and the abrogation of the alliance with the U.S. This can be considered as the biggest success.
					
					 They would as ever carry on their actions against the formation of the triangular alliance involving south Korea, the U.S. and Japan and for the conclusion of an agreement on peace on the Korean Peninsula, they noted.
					
					 They added they would advance together till the nation becomes one.

articles.title: S. Korean Unionists Protest against Misrule
articles.content:
S. Korean Unionists Protest against Misrule 
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Members of the Government Employees' Union of south Korea staged an action against the unpopular rule of the puppet authorities at the hall of the "National Assemblymen" on September 22, according to the south Korean CBS.
					 That day the ruling party and the Pension Society held a seminar on the reform policy on the pension for the government employees with an aim to cut down the pensions for the government employees.
					
					 Enraged at this, the unionists staged a protest even before the start of the seminar, chanting slogans against the draft reform proposed by the Society.
					
					 The coteries of the "Saenuri Party" went desperate to make a "congratulatory speech" but the seminar ended halfway due to the angry protest made by the unionists.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by Foreign Media
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- Media of various countries featured articles to mark the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Prensa Latina of Cuba said on September 8:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK on Sept. 9, 1948. This was a landmark event for the Korean people in carving out their destiny. No matter how often an old generation is replaced by a new one, the exploits he performed by honorably protecting the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK will last forever.
					
					 Kuwait Times on Sept. 7 introduced the exploits he performed by liberating and building the country.
					
					 Recalling that he devoted his great wisdom and energy to instituting the name of the country, its flag and emblem, the paper praised the President as the founder of the DPRK and father of socialist Korea who thoroughly applied the principle of independence in politics, self-support in economy and self-reliance in national defence.
					
					 The September issue of the British paper Line of March noted in an article:
					
					 Under the wise leadership of the President, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un, the DPRK grew stronger to be an impregnable fortress protecting peace and security of the region from the provocations of the imperialists and instilling strength and courage into the world people.
					
					 The Korean people are confident of their rosy future through the whole historic course of the Korean revolution which emerged victorious under the leadership of the President and Kim Jong Il and the life experience they gained while dynamically stepping up the building of a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un in recent years.

articles.title: DPRK's History Introduced by Foreign Media
articles.content:
DPRK's History Introduced by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, September 25 (KCNA) -- The history of the DPRK was introduced by foreign media from Sept. 8 to 15 in celebration of the 66th anniversary of its foundation.
					 The Mexican paper Unidad Nacional carried an article titled "Impregnable socialist state" illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The paper introduced the history of the DPRK which demonstrated its dignity as a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defense under the guidance of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 An Algerian paper carried an article titled "For the building of a thriving nation and national reunification", which said that the DPRK, which was founded by the original nation-building idea of the President, has dynamically advanced along the road of building a thriving nation and national reunification.
					
					 The Senegalese paper Le Populaire said that the DPRK successfully carried out the historic task of industrialization in a matter of 14 years and ranked itself among satellite manufacturers and launchers and nuclear weapons states in the world.
					
					 The news agency and paper of Angola and its State TV Broadcasting Service and National Radio Broadcasting Service praised the feats the President performed in the nation-building and underscored the need to boost the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations.
					
					 The Guinean domestic and international broadcasting services and seven language radio broadcasting service gave a detailed account of the fact that the DPRK, which turned into a prosperous socialist state and invincible power under the leadership of the President and Kim Jong Il, is more powerfully demonstrating its might as a political, ideological and military power under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Tiene lugar segundo periodo de sesiones de XIII legislatura de APS
articles.content:
Tiene lugar segundo periodo de sesiones de XIII legislatura de APS
 Pyongyang, 25 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 25 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae el segundo periodo de sesiones de la XIII legislatura de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					 Participaron en la ocasion los diputados a la APS.
					
					 Estuvieron presentes en calidad de observador los funcionarios de los organos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, entidades sociales, ministerios, organos centrales y de las ramas de ciencia, educacion, literatura y arte, salud publica, prensa e informacion.
					
					 Todos los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					 El presidente de la APS Choe Thae Bok pronuncio un discurso de apertura.
					
					 En la agenda se incluyeron el balance del estado de ejecucion de la ley de la APS de la RPDC "Sobre la implementacion de la ensenanza obligatoria general de 12 anos" y el problema de organizacion.
					
					 El diputado Pak Pong Ju, primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, presento el informe sobre el primer punto de la agenda.
					
					 Segun el informe, quedo promulgada en el sexto periodo de sesiones de la XII Legislatura de la APS, efectuado en septiembre del 101 (2012) de la Era Juche, la ley sobre la implementacion de la ensenanza obligatoria general de 12 anos conforme a las nuevas demandas de la revolucion en desarrollo.
					
					 Se ha impulsado energicamente como asunto de todo el Estado, todo el pueblo y toda la sociedad la labor para aplicar exitosamente la ensenanza obligatoria general de 12 anos y se lograron en ese curso valiosos resultados.
					
					 Termino en un corto tiempo la division de la escuela secundaria de 6 anos en la basica de 3 anos y la superior de 3 anos que ya entraron en operacion.
					
					 En un ano y medio, se ha elaborado el primer programa de ensenanza obligatoria general de 12 anos y quedaron redactados los manuales de nuevos contenidos y formas.
					
					 Al aumentar en el presupuesto estatal los gastos sobre la rama de educacion y hacer garantizar por el plan el Comite Estatal de Planificacion,  el Ministerio de Finanzas, los comites populares de las provincias y los organos correspondientes los fondos necesarios a la labor educativa, posibilitaron fortalecer las bases materiales y tecnicas de las escuelas.
					
					  Durante los ultimos 2 anos despues de la proclamacion de la ley, se construyeron o se ampliaron las aulas en las escuelas a lo largo del pais y se produjeron muchos equipamientos escolares.
					
					  El informante enumero las tareas presentadas ante la rama de educacion.
					
					 Hay que formar bien las filas de maestros y elevar decisivamente su nivel y papel.
					
					 Puesto que se inauguraran con caracter experimental las secundarias superiores tecnicas, las secundarias generales tienen que ensenar principalmente los conocimientos generales de ensenanza media y aquellas han de impulsar con responsabilidad los preparativos para impartir la educacion tecnica basica, que convenga a las caracteristicas economicas y geograficas de las respectivas zonas, ademas de la ensenanza general.
					
					 Es preciso impulsar activamente las labores para desarrollar en un nivel mas alto la ensenanza media general del pais, incluyendo la educacion de genios, asi como preparar bien el colectivo de investigadores de las instituciones de educacion y estudio cientifico y elevar su responsabilidad y papel.
					
					 Se debe cambiar por completo las condiciones y ambiente de ensenanza conforme al aspecto de pais civilizado socialista.
					
					 Los diputados, que intervinieron seguidamente, expresaron la decision de elevar decisivamente la calidad de educacion tomando en cuenta la tendencia mundial y las demandas reales de la epoca de economia basada en intelectualidad.
					
					 Asi contribuiremos a formar a las nuevas generaciones como personal revolucionario del tipo Juche que haya adquirido perfectos conocimientos de ensenanza media, modernos conocimientos de tecnologias basicas y capacidad creativa, recalcaron.
					
					 Fue adoptada la resolucion de la APS de la RPDC "Para implementar generalmente la ensenanza obligatoria general de 12 anos y elevar decisivamente su calidad".
					
					 Seguidamente, fue debatido el segundo punto de la agenda.
					
					 El diputado Chor Ryong Hae y el diputado Jang Jong Nam fueron removidos del vicepresidente y del miembro del CDN de la RPDC debido a cambio de cargos.
					
					 A la propuesta del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, el diputado Hwang Pong So fue elegido al vicepresidente vacante del CDN de la RPDC.
					
					 Los diputados Hyon Yong Chol y Ri Pyong Chol fueron elegidos a miembros vacantes del CDN de la RPDC.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita dia nacional de Armenia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita dia nacional de Armenia
 Pyongyang, 25 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 21 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Armenia, Serge Sarkissian, con motivo del dia nacional de ese pais.
					 El remitente desea al destinatario buena salud y grandes exitos en su labor para el desarrollo y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Clausurado el XIV Festival Internacional de Cine de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Clausurado el XIV Festival Internacional de Cine de Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, 25 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo clausurado el dia 24 el XIV Festival Internacional de Cine de Pyongyang.
					 A la ocasion asistieron el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Yang Hyong Sop, el ministro de Cultura y presidente del Comite Organizador del Festival, Pak Chun Nam, el presidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Cha Hui Rim, el viceministro de Cultura y titular de la Direccion General de Pelicula, Kim In Bom, y otros funcionarios, las delegaciones y delegados de varios paises y los jurados internacionales.
					
					 Fueron invitados los matrimonios de los representantes diplomaticos y de organizaciones internacionales y los funcionarios encargados de asuntos culturales de las embajadas de varios paises, acreditados en Corea.
					
					 Fueron presentados los filmes ganadores del festival y publicadas las decisiones del jurado y hubo la premiacion.
					
					 Quedo aprobada una carta dirigida al Mariscal Kim Jong Un por los participantes en el festival.
					
					 El discurso de clausura estuvo a cargo de Pak Chun Nam.

articles.title: Tiene lugar festival de turismo deportivo de Rason
articles.content:
Tiene lugar festival de turismo deportivo de Rason
 Pyongyang, 25 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 24 en la ciudad de Rason el festival de turismo deportivo de Rason de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					 En la ocasion participaron mas de 250 aficionados al deporte de varios paises, incluyendo Rusia, Mongolia, China, Grecia, Dinamarca, Alemania y Suecia.
					
					 Ellos compitieron en las pistas de 31.5km, 21km y 3.5km, acondicionadas en esa ciudad para el ciclismo, el semi-maraton y la carrera- caminata, respectivamente.
					
					 Hubo la ceremonia de premiacion con la participacion de los funcionarios de la rama turistica de la ciudad de Rason y extranjeros, los aficionados al deporte y los trabajadores urbanos.
					
					 Hubo discursos de felicitacion y se otorgaron premios a los jugadores sobresalientes.
